bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander G. Clark to William F. Wharton, December 8, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No 5 dispatch Consilate Series, Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia December 8th 1890
No 5 Consul Series, Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia December 8th 1890
To the Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of several parcels addressed to the Legation containing viz. 1. copy Foreign Relations of the United States for 1889, 2. copies Special consul reports on Cotton tephles in foreign countries.
2. copies Special consul reports on Malt and Bill in Spanish America.
2. Copies special consular reports on Carpet manufacture in foreign countries.
copies consular reports 2 each May, June, and July Nos 116-117 and 118- of 1890.

2. Copies message from the president teaching the Select in dispute between the government of the United States and Grate Britain in the Behring Sea. 4 Copies No 330 Act to reduce the and equalize duties on imports and for other purposes
2 Copies report on condition of crops for 1890.
2 copies of the inestimable Report of the quarternational American Conference relation to intercontinental callway care and several forms Nos, 138-129-140-171 and 172
I have the honor to remain Sir, your obedient servant
Alexander Clark Minister Resident and Consul General of U.S.
